title: Water for a city
creator_contributor_role: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, production company
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Conservation of natural resources - Australia
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Water-supply - Australia
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Water - Pollution - Australia
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Water use
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Water consumption
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Cities and towns - Growth - Social aspects
description: Episode of Series "Australian Geography". Contrasts the need and the scarcity of water in Australia with the high per capita consumption in our cities. Shows briefly the processes of water supply, pollution control, purification and the variety of uses to which water is put in a city. Suitable for upper secondary level.
